title: Decimal amounts not converted to fractions
description: ~1100+ fixtures have amounts like '0.5', '0.75', '1.5' that could be displayed as '1/2', '3/4', '1 1/2' for readability. This is a presentation choice - current behavior isn't wrong, just less idiomatic for recipes. Would need a conversion function for common decimals. Low priority.

title: Standalone continuation lines starting with and/or/plus
description: ~20 lines in ingredient-categories.csv have orphaned continuation lines like 'and 2 Tbsp sugar', 'or 2 regular carrots', 'plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil'. These likely belong to the previous ingredient as an alternative/addition but currently parse as orphaned lines.

title: Footnote asterisks in item names
description: ~7 fixtures have items like 'cherry tomatoes*' where the asterisk is a footnote marker. Low impact and potentially risky to strip (what if someone writes 'brand*name'?). Probably acceptable to leave as-is.

title: Concatenated ingredient lines
description: Unknown count of cases where multiple ingredients end up on one line like '3/4 cup (180ml) milk 1/4 cup (60ml) vegetable oil'. This is an extraction bug upstream (ingredients should be on separate lines), not a parser bug. The parser can't reasonably split these without risking false positives.

title: Trailing semicolon in items
description: ~3 fixtures (kingarthurbaking) have semicolons used as separators sticking to item names, e.g., item='Parmesan cheese, grated;'. Low impact.

title: Non-ingredient/equipment lines leaking into ingredient lists
description: Spotty but recurring issue where equipment/non-ingredient lines end up in ingredient lists. Examples: 'A 12-cup Bundt pan, a pastry bag, and a large star tip', '9x13 metal baking pans or large roasting pan lined with foil', 'Burger accompaniments, as you like'. Should be filtered upstream or flagged as section headers.

title: Comma-separated conditional quantities
description: ~2 fixtures (paprika) have lines with multiple quantities for different use cases, like '4 cups vegetable broth (for dried but soaked chickpeas), 1 1/2 cups vegetable broth (for cooked chickpeas)'. Currently only the first measurement is extracted; the second alternative ends up in the item field. Tricky because comma normally separates item from prep notes. May need special handling for patterns where text after comma starts with a number+unit.
